00010  * $NoKeywords: $

00013 /*
00014  * Information Filter Scheme.
00015  *  A possibly non-linear Information filter
00016  *
00017  * References
00018  * [1] "Stochastic Models, Estimation, and Control} Peter S Maybeck, Academic Press, ISBN 0-12-480701-1
00019  *      Section 5.7
00020  * [2] "Kalman Filtering, Theory and Practice", Mohinder S. Grewal, Angus P. Andrews ISBN 0-13-211335-X
00021  * To work with with Linear and Linrz models
00022  *  a) a seperate state and information (via covariance) predict is used.
00023  *  b) a EIF modified innovation update algorithm is used.
00024  *
00025  * Two alternative algorithms are used for predict functions:
00026  *  For linrz models an extended predict form is used so information state 'y' is predicted via the
00027  *  non-linear function. This requires that X, and Y are invertable so 'x' can be computed.
00028  * For linear invertable models predict can be done directly without computing x
00029  * Discontinous observe models require that predict is normailised with
00030  * respect to the observation.
00031  * NUMERICS
00032  *  The state x is respresented by prod(X,y). This may be illconditioned if the product is
00033  *  illconditioned. At present only the conditioning of X if checked, if y has a large range the product
00034  *  may be illconditioned. This is not checked
00035  *
00036  * The filter is operated by performing a
00037  *  predict, observe
00038  * cycle defined by the base class
00039  */
00040 #include "bayesFlt.hpp"
00041 
00042 /* Filter namespace */
00043 namespace Bayesian_filter
00044 {
00045 
00046 class Information_scheme : public Extended_kalman_filter, virtual public Information_state_filter
00047 {
00048 public:
00049     Information_scheme (std::size_t x_size, std::size_t z_initialsize = 0);
00050     Information_scheme& operator= (const Information_scheme&);
00051     // Optimise copy assignment to only copy filter state
00052 
00053     struct Linear_predict_byproducts
00054     {
00055          Linear_predict_byproducts (std::size_t x_size, std::size_t q_size);
00056          FM::SymMatrix A;
00057          FM::Matrix tempG;
00058          FM::SymMatrix B;
00059          FM::Vec y;
00060     };
00061 
00062 
00063     void init ();
00064     void update ();
00065     void init_yY ();
00066     void update_yY ();
00067     // Covariance and information form state interface
00068 
00069     Float predict (Linear_invertable_predict_model& f, Linear_predict_byproducts& b);
00070     // Linear Prediction in information form as in Ref[2]
00071     Float predict (Linear_invertable_predict_model& f)
00072     {
00073         Linear_predict_byproducts b(f.Fx.size1(),f.q.size());
00074         return predict (f, b);  
00075     }
00076 
00077     Float predict (Linrz_predict_model& f);
00078     // Extended Prediction via state
00079 
00080     Float observe_innovation (Linrz_uncorrelated_observe_model& h, const FM::Vec& s);
00081     Float observe_innovation (Linrz_correlated_observe_model& h, const FM::Vec& s);
00082 
00083 protected:
00084     bool update_required;   // Postcondition of update is not met
00085 
00086 protected:                  // Permenantly allocated temps
00087     FM::RowMatrix tempX;
00088     FM::Vec i;
00089     FM::SymMatrix I;
00090                     // allow fast operation if z_size remains constant
00091     FM::SymMatrix ZI;
00092     std::size_t last_z_size;
00093     void observe_size (std::size_t z_size);
00094 };
